New Records: Luka Doncic recorded 32 points, nine rebounds, and seven assists in the game.
The Dallas Mavericks set a new record with a 65-40 halftime lead.
Key Match Events: The Mavericks outscored the Magic 30-9 in the first 9:30 of the second quarter.
Orlando struggled without Paolo Banchero and Wendell Carter Jr., leading to a season-worst 19.5% three-point shooting.
Pre-Game Insights: The Magic were playing their second game without Paolo Banchero, who was out with a torn right oblique.
Orlando's left plantar fascia strain limited Wendell Carter Jr.'s first-half performance.
Post-Match Reflections: The Magic finished with a season-low 19.5% on three-pointers (8 of 41).
Luka Doncic's performance was a bounce-back game after scoring just 25 points in his previous outing.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mavericks outscored the Magic 19-12 in fast-break points.
Dallas finished with a season-high 53 rebounds.
